title: Gunman Attacks Michigan Church: 1 Dead, 9 Injured, Building Set Ablaze
snippets: Multiple people have been shot at a Mormon church in Michigan and the shooter is down, police said Sunday.
Police in Grand Blanc Township warn that more victims are likely to be found after a fire at the building.
Multiple people have been injured and one killed in a shooting at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, local police said. The church was also set alight.

Church on fire in violent weekend with shootings also in North Carolina, Texas, and New Orleans’ Bourbon Street

At least one victim is dead and nine others are injured after a shooting and a fire at a Mormon church in Michigan, auth
Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer said that her heart is breaking for the Grand Blanc community. “Violence anywhere especially in a place of worship, is unacceptable,” she said.

GRAND BLANC TOWNSHIP, Mich. (AP) — A gunman opened fire inside a Mormon church in Michigan during Sunday services before apparently setting the building ablaze, killing at least one person and injuring nine before police shot him, authorities said Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus C
titles: Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 1 dead, 9 injured
One dead, nine injured in shooting at Mormon church in Michigan: Police
US: One dead, others wounded in shooting at Mormon church
At least one dead and nine injured after shooting at Mormon church in Michigan
1 dead and 9 injured in shooting inside Michigan church, police say
1 person dead and 9 injured in a shooting and fire at a Michigan church, police say
summary: A gunman attacked The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, during Sunday services, resulting in at least one death and nine injuries. The assailant also set the church on fire before being shot by police. Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer expressed her heartbreak over the violence, emphasizing that such acts, especially in places of worship, are unacceptable. The incident is part of a violent weekend with shootings in several U.S. locations.

title: NYC Mayor Adams Suspends Campaign Amid Funding Issues, Crowded Race
snippets: Adams bows out, leaving the race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced on Sunday that he is suspending his campaign for mayor, just weeks away from the closely watched election.
President Donald Trump has suggested that NYC Mayor Eric Adams and Curtis Sliwa, the Republican nominee, should both drop out of the race.
Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo will now face off in city’s November poll

New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My Way

The mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sund
Adams’ withdrawal sets up a three-way race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani, Republican Curtis Sliwa and former Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who is running as an independent.
Adams announced his departure on Sunday in an eight-minute video on X, saying media speculation and lack of funding influenced his decision.
titles: Eric Adam says he is dropping out of New York City mayoral race
Eric Adams ends campaign for New York City mayor
Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
New York mayor Eric Adams abandons re-election bid
Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
Eric Adams Drops Out Of New York City Mayoral Race
Eric Adams drops out of the New York mayor's race weeks ahead of the election
summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has suspended his re-election campaign, citing media speculation and funding issues. His withdrawal sets up a race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani, Republican Curtis Sliwa, and former Governor Andrew Cuomo, running as an independent. Adams made the announcement through a social media video. President Trump had suggested both Adams and Sliwa should drop out. The election is set for November.

title: Denmark Bans Civilian Drones Amid Security Concerns, Closes Airports
snippets: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.
Denmark is closing its entire airspace to civilian drones. The ban comes as the Nordic country prepares to host European leaders after a flurry of suspicious drone activity in recent days.
Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders

Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions

Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Cope
This is the latest unexplained drone activity after several sightings, including over five Danish airports last week.
titles: Denmark bans drone flights after latest drone sightings at military bases
Denmark bans civil drones after more sightings
Denmark bans civil drones for a week after sightings over military bases
Denmark reports more drone sightings ahead of European summits
Denmark reports new drone sightings over army bases, NATO ups surveillance
summary: Recent drone activity, including sightings over five Danish airports, has prompted Denmark to temporarily close several airports and raise security concerns. Ahead of two European leaders' summits, the Danish government announced a ban on all civilian drone flights this week, especially after drones were observed at military sites. This measure aims to enhance security amid the unexplained drone incursions.

title: Giants' Malik Nabers Carted Off Field, Feared to Have Torn ACL
snippets: Giants star wide receiver Malik Nabers is feared to have a torn ACL, a source told ESPN.
Nabers jumped for a high pass and was writhing in pain when he landed
Giants WR Malik Nabers is feared to have torn ACL. We look at the fantasy football impact for the rest of 2025 and beyond.
New York Giants star wide receiver Malik Nabers was carted from the field with an apparent injured right leg in the second quarter against the Los Angeles Chargers on Sunday.
titles: Source: Giants' Nabers feared to have torn ACL
Malik Nabers injury: Giants star WR believed to have torn ACL against Chargers, per report
Fantasy Football Fallout of Malik Nabers injury: How Giants WR's potential torn ACL impacts lineups
Giants’ Malik Nabers carted off, believed to have suffered torn ACL
summary: New York Giants wide receiver Malik Nabers suffered an apparent right leg injury after jumping for a pass against the Los Angeles Chargers. He was carted off the field in pain. Sources fear Nabers has a torn ACL, which could significantly impact his availability for the rest of the 2025 season and potentially beyond.

title: Steelers' Skylar Thompson Robbed, Incident Under Investigation
snippets: Steelers quarterback Skylar Thompson was robbed in Ireland on Friday night, sources told ESPN's Brooke Pryor. Thompson is on IR with a hamstring injury, but traveled with the team for Sunday's game against the Vikings.
The incident occurred on Friday night

• Ireland hosts country’s first NFL regular-season game

  • Steelers backup QB was ‘jumped and robbed’ on Friday

Kenneth Gainwell ran for 99 yards and two touchdowns and the Pittsburgh Steelers held on to beat the Minnesota Vikings 24-21 on Sunday in Ireland’s fi
The Pittsburgh Steelers confirmed that backup quarterback Skylar Thompson was involved in an incident Friday night after a report that the player had been robbed.
titles: Sources: Steelers QB Thompson robbed in Dublin
Steelers QB Skylar Thompson jumped, robbed in Ireland, suffers minor injuries
Steelers beat Vikings in Dublin after Pittsburgh’s Thompson injured in robbery
Report: Steelers backup QB Skylar Thompson robbed in Dublin
summary: The Pittsburgh Steelers confirmed that backup quarterback Skylar Thompson was involved in an incident on Friday night, following reports that he was robbed. The current status of the situation is under investigation.

title: Moldova Votes in Key Election Amid Cyberattacks, Eyes on EU Path
snippets: The vote is seen as critical for Moldova's future EU path, with the two main political forces thought to be neck and neck.

Day marked by attempts of disruption including cyberattacks on election systems and fake bomb threats

Moldovans voted in a pivotal parliamentary election on Sunday that will decide whether the country of 2.4 million stays on its path towards EU membership or drifts back into Moscow’s orbit,
Parliamentary elections in this nation bordering Ukraine come at a critical moment in Moldova’s push for European Union membership.

CHISINAU, Moldova (AP) — Moldovans are awaiting the results of their closely-watched parliamentary election Sunday, a race fraught with claims of Russian interference. Many viewed the ballot as a geopolitical choice between a path to the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold.
titles: Moldovans await pivotal election result as leader warns of Russian interference
Moldovans vote in pivotal election that could steer it closer to EU or Russia
For Many Moldovans, Their Election Is a Choice Between Russia and the E.U.
Moldova awaits election results in vote plagued by Russian interference claims
summary: Moldova held a closely-watched parliamentary election, seen as pivotal for its EU membership aspirations. The election day faced disruptions, including cyberattacks and fake bomb threats. The outcome will influence whether Moldova continues towards the EU or shifts back towards Russian influence. Results are awaited amid claims of Russian interference.

title: Stampede at Tamil Nadu Rally for Actor Vijay Kills 39, Injures 40
snippets: A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.
Tens of thousands had gathered at a campaign event for actor-turned-politician Vijay in India's southern state of Tamil Nadu.
A crowd crush at a campaign rally for popular actor-turned-politician Vijay has killed at least 39 people in Karur.
The stampede took place at an event for Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, the popular actor known professionally as Vijay.
titles: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in India
Crowd crush kills dozens in India at political rally for Tamil actor Vijay
Stampede at Actor’s Political Rally Kills at Least 38 in India
summary: A stampede at a campaign rally in Tamil Nadu for actor-turned-politician Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, known as Vijay, resulted in at least 39 deaths, including eight children, and injured 40 others. The incident occurred in Karur during an event for the popular Indian actor and politician.

title: Ryder Cup Announcer Resigns, Apologizes for McIlroy Chant Incident
snippets: Some of the golf at this year's Ryder Cup has been overshadowed by interventions from passionate and unruly fans, as Americans tee off against Europeans in one of the sport's biggest events.

• Heather McMahan led crowd in chant at Bethpage

  • PGA of America apologised 20 hours later

The comedian employed to warm up the crowd at the Ryder Cup has apologised and stepped down from her job before the final day’s play after she was recorded leading a foul
The Ryder Cup first-tee announcer who encouraged expletive-filled chants at Rory McIlroy has apologised and stepped down, the PGA of America has confirmed.
titles: Ryder Cup MC steps down over foul-mouthed chant aimed at golfer Rory McIlroy
Ryder Cup MC apologises and steps down over foul-mouthed McIlroy chant
Ryder Cup MC steps down after encouraging expletive-filled Rory chants
summary: The first-tee announcer at the Ryder Cup, who prompted the crowd to chant expletives at Rory McIlroy, has apologized and resigned from her role, as confirmed by the PGA of America.

Multiple people were shot Sunday at the Church of Latter Day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, police said.
Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a man rammed his vehicle into the front door then started shooting.
titles: Ten shot, 1 killed at Michigan church and fire set "deliberately," police say - Axios
At least 10 shot, 2 fatally, at Michigan church set on fire by the gunman: Police
Gunman sets Michigan church on fire while killing at least 1 person and injuring 9, police say
summary: A man attacked the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, by ramming his vehicle into the church's front door and opening fire while hundreds were inside. The incident resulted in ten people being shot, with one fatality confirmed by police.

title: Gabriel's Late Goal Seals Arsenal Comeback Win at Newcastle
snippets: Gabriel scores a 96th-minute winner as Arsenal come from behind to beat Newcastle United in the Premier League at St James' Park.

During a year as a Newcastle midfielder under Rafael Benítez, Mikel Merino struggled to settle in the north-east and departed for Real Sociedad without offering Tynesiders more than a few glimpses of his best work.

Much to Eddie Howe’s chagrin, Merino jogged a few memories here as, seven ye
Gabriel scored a stoppage-time winner for Arsenal following a brilliant corner from Martin Odegaard in the Gunners' Premier League clash with Newcastle.
titles: Late Gabriel winner snatches victory for Arsenal at Newcastle
Gabriel Magalhães stuns Newcastle with last-gasp comeback winner for Arsenal
What a moment! Gabriel heads in 96th-min winner to seal EPIC Arsenal comeback
summary: Gabriel scored in the 96th minute to secure a comeback victory for Arsenal against Newcastle United in the Premier League at St James' Park. The decisive goal came from a corner by Martin Odegaard, allowing Arsenal to win the match.

title: Al Horford Joins Golden State Warriors with Multi-Year Deal
snippets: Horford is the latest apron casualty for the Celtics and now can chase a title with the Warriors
Al Horford has signed a multi-year deal with the Golden State Warriors according to ESPN’s Shams Charania. The 19th year veteran looks to add to the Warriors reserves.
The Golden State Warriors have made a big late off-season addition. Al Horford has agreed on a multi-year contract with the club, ESPN’s Shams Charania reported on Sunday.
titles: Al Horford signing with Warriors: Celtics legend lands in Golden State for 19th NBA season, per report
Al Horford Signs Multi-Year Deal With Golden State Warriors
Report: Al Horford joins Warriors on multi-year contract
summary: Al Horford, a 19-year veteran of the NBA, has signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors, as reported by ESPN's Shams Charania. This move adds Horford to the Warriors' bench, strengthening their lineup as they aim for another title.

title: UN Reimposes Sanctions on Iran Over Nuclear Concerns
snippets: The United Nations reimposed sanctions on Iran early Sunday over its nuclear program, further squeezing the Islamic Republic as its people increasingly find themselves priced out of the food they need to survive and worried about their futures.
The United Nations has reimposed sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program

Foreign ministry attacks ‘unjustifiable’ return of measures expected to have wide effects on troubled economy

Widespread UN sanctions against Iran have come back into force for the first time in a decade, prompting anger from Tehran, after last-ditch nuclear talks with western powers failed
titles: UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on a hungrier, poorer and more anxious Iran
UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program
Iran angry as sweeping UN sanctions take effect after failure of nuclear talks
summary: The United Nations has reimposed sanctions on Iran due to concerns over its nuclear program, marking the first return of such measures in a decade. This decision comes after nuclear talks with Western powers failed, significantly affecting Iran's already troubled economy and exacerbating the financial difficulties faced by its citizens. Tehran has criticized the sanctions as "unjustifiable."

title: Michael A. Taylor Retires Before Season Finale After 12 MLB Seasons
snippets: White Sox outfielder Michael A. Taylor announced his retirement after 12 MLB seasons. He also played for the Nationals, Royals, Twins and Pirates in his career.
Chicago White Sox outfielder Michael A. Taylor announced his retirement before Sunday’s season finale against the Washington Nationals.
titles: White Sox OF Taylor retiring after 12 MLB seasons
White Sox outfielder Michael A. Taylor announces retirement after 12 seasons
summary: Michael A. Taylor, an outfielder for the Chicago White Sox, announced his retirement before the season finale against the Washington Nationals. Taylor's career spanned 12 MLB seasons, during which he also played for the Nationals, Royals, Twins, and Pirates.

summary: Arkansas has fired coach Sam Pittman following a significant home loss to Notre Dame. Bobby Petrino has been named as the interim coach. The decision comes after the blowout defeat, signaling a change in leadership for the team.

Defend Our Juries says about 100 people had gathered holding signs outside conference venue in Liverpool

Police have arrested protesters on suspicion of supporting the banned group Palestine Action outside the Labour party conference in Liverpool.

About 100 people gathered silently on
titles: Arrests at protest supporting Palestine Action near Labour conference
‘Dozens’ arrested at Palestine Action protest outside Labour party conference
summary: Merseyside Police arrested protesters outside the Labour party conference in Liverpool for allegedly supporting the banned group Palestine Action. Approximately 100 individuals had gathered silently with signs at the event, as reported by Defend Our Juries.

Internationally recognized a

Tyla and Liza Koshy help remind the Global Citizen Festival audience of their collective power

title: Swiss Voters Narrowly Approve Electronic ID Cards in Referendum
snippets: The proposal was backed by 50.4% of voters, in the second Swiss ballot on the issue in four years.

Pollsters confounded by 50.4% support for e-IDs after forecasting stronger backing for ‘yes’ vote

Swiss voters have backed plans for electronic identity cards by a wafer-thin margin, in the second nationwide vote on the issue.

In a referendum on Sunday, 50.4% of voters supported an
titles: Swiss voters narrowly approve plan for electronic ID cards
Swiss voters back electronic identity cards in close vote
summary: Swiss voters narrowly approved the introduction of electronic identity cards, with 50.4% in favor in a recent referendum. This marks the second vote on the issue within four years, defying pollsters' expectations of stronger support for the proposal.

title: Trump Calls Bipartisan Meeting as Funding Deadline Looms
snippets: Republicans and Democrats trade blame as deadline approaches to agree funding deal

US president reverses course days after scrapping meeting to discuss crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer

Donald Trump has reversed course and is purportedly planning to host a bipartisan gathering of the top four US con
titles: Trump to meet lawmakers as US government heads to a shutdown
Trump to meet with US congressional leaders in last-ditch effort to avoid shutdown
summary: As the deadline for a funding deal nears, Republicans and Democrats are blaming each other. President Trump, after initially canceling a meeting to address the crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer, has decided to hold a bipartisan meeting with the top four US congressional leaders to discuss the situation.

title: Gov Backs Carmaker with £1.5bn Loan After Cyber-Attack Halts Production
snippets: Liam Byrne spoke after the government announced it was backing a £1.5bn loan to the company, and warned cyber-attacks could become more common.
Carmaker receives official backing after cyber attack that has halted production

summary: The government has supported a carmaker with a £1.5bn loan following a cyber-attack that stopped production. Liam Byrne highlighted the incident as a warning that cyber-attacks may increase in frequency.

title: Government Shutdown Looms, Stocks Stay Resilient in September
snippets: No one wants to shoulder the government shutdown blame&n
Stocks are defying their typical weakness in September — but it isn’t October yet
titles: No one wants to shoulder the government shutdown blame - Axios
The last thing the stock market wants right now is a government shutdown. Here’s why.
summary: Amid concerns over a potential government shutdown, no party is willing to take the blame for the impasse. Meanwhile, contrary to usual trends, stock markets have shown resilience in September, although the situation could change with the arrival of October.

title: Russia Deploys Kamikaze Drones in Kyiv After Zelensky-Trump Meeting
snippets: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.
Russia’s missile and drone attack came days after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s meeting with President Donald Trump at the U.N. General Assembly.
titles: Heavy Russian drone attack kills at least four in Ukraine’s capital Kyiv
Four dead as massive Russian attack on Kyiv hits apartments, hospital
summary: Russia launched a significant attack on Ukraine, employing hundreds of kamikaze drones targeting residential areas in Kyiv. This aggressive action followed shortly after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's meeting with President Donald Trump at the U.N. General Assembly.

title: Kyiv Hit by Over 600 Drones and Missiles; Casualties Reported
snippets: More than 600 drones and missiles, predominantly aimed at Kyiv, hit factories and the Institute of Cardiology.

Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four people

One of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile
titles: Zelensky condemns 'vile' Russian strikes lasting 12 hours
Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘vile and cowardly’ 12-hour bombing of Ukraine
summary: Over 600 drones and missiles targeted Kyiv, impacting factories and the Institute of Cardiology, resulting in casualties including a 12-year-old girl. Concurrently, unidentified drones were observed over Danish military bases. At the UN General Assembly, Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov issued a warning against aggression towards Russia.

title: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco Wed in California, Celebrities Attend
snippets: Gomez shared pictures online of her in a white wedding gown, and guests included Taylor Swift and actor Paul Rudd.

Emmy- and Grammy-nominated performer announces marriage online with photos from California ceremony

Emmy- and Grammy-nominated performer Selena Gomez has married music producer and songwriter Benny Blanco, announcing the news in an
titles: Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco
Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco: ‘My wife in real life’
summary: Selena Gomez married music producer and songwriter Benny Blanco in California, announcing their marriage with photos online. The ceremony was attended by celebrities including Taylor Swift and Paul Rudd. Blanco and Gomez shared their joy on Instagram, with Blanco referring to Gomez as "my wife in real life."
